Welcome to Contacts API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶
main.read_root()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body against the contactschema schema

  • db – AsyncSession: Interact with the database

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays_within_next_week(db: AsyncSession, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthdays_within_next_week function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays within the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact you want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to get contacts that they own

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the given user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the offset of the first row to return

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to delete the contact

Returns:

A contact object or none if the contact does not exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → List[Contact]¶
The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

The search is case insensitive and will return any contact whose first name, last name, or email address contains the query string. The function returns a list of Contact objects.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for a contact by name or email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to search for contacts they have created

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, db: AsyncSession, user: User) → Contact | None¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to update

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only updating their own contacts

Returns:

The updated contact or none if the contact doesn’t exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

None, so the return type is none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Deserialize the request body into a userschema object

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session to be used

Returns:

A user object, which is then serialized into a json response

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • url – str | None: Specify the new avatar url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the user’s refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

  • token – str | None: Set the refresh_token field of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

Nothing, so it should be declared as returning none

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactSchema object as input, and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the token

Returns:

The contact object, which is a dict

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact function returns a contact by its id.

If the user is not logged in, an HTTP 401 Unauthorized response is returned. If the contact does not exist, an HTTP 404 Not Found response is returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to view the contact

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify that the limit must be greater than or equal to 10

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the limit parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next week.

The user is authenticated using the auth_service dependency, and then passed to the repository function.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (AsyncSession, optional): An async session for interacting with the database. Defaults to Depends(get_db). user (User, optional): A User object representing the current user making this request. Defaults to Depends(auth_service.get_current_user).

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id of the contact to be removed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

query (str): The search term to use when searching for contacts. db (AsyncSession): An async session object used to interact with the database. user (User): A User object representing the current user making this request.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for contacts in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes a ContactUpdate object, which is defined in models.py, and uses it to update the contact with id = contact_id. If no such contact exists, an HTTP 404 error is raised.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Pass the data that will be used to update the contact

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It uses the auth_service to retrieve the current user, and returns it if found.

Parameters:

user – User: Get the user object from the auth_service

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained from auth_service’s get_current_user function. This ensures that only authenticated users can access this endpoint and change their own avatar image. Finally, it takes in an AsyncSession object for database access.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database and whether or not their account has already been confirmed. If everything checks out, we update their account status in our database.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the email and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the message key and a string value

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, request: Request, bt: BackgroundTasks, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account already exists with that email address, it will return an HTTP 409 error code.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A userschema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The iat (issued at) claim is set to now, while the exp (expiration) claim is set to 3 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function takes a refresh token and decodes it.

If the scope is ‘refresh_token’, then we return the email address of the user. Otherwise, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user if the refresh token is valid

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the UserController class. It takes an OAuth2 token as input and returns the user object associated with it.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection, and the token: str parameter is used to pass in the access_token

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the token using jwt.decode, which is part of PyJWT, a Python library for encoding and decoding JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). If successful, it will return the email address associated with that JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address that was used to create the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Store the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them. -username: the username of the user, which is displayed in the body of the message. -host: this is used as part of constructing a URL that will be sent to users so they can verify their account.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

The following:

Doc-author:

Trelent
